benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to invoice item

covered: Valid Request: The tests exercise multiple valid PUT payloads and expect 204 with DB updates (TC01, TC21).
Non-Existing Resource: Tests cover 404 for missing items (TC07, TC24, TC25).
Authorization: Tests include missing/invalid authentication (TC13) and missing header (TC09) as appropriate error responses.

Error Handling and Validation: Tests cover invalid invoiceItemId format (TC06), malformed JSON (TC08), missing required header (TC09), empty request body (TC10), unsupported fields (TC11), and oversized payload (TC12).
Resiliency: Tests simulate server/service outages (TC15 - 500, TC19 - 503, TC16 - 504).
Idempotency and Regression: Repeated identical updates (TC17) and regression scenario ensuring no data loss (TC18).
Edge Cases and Performance: URL edge case with extra parameters (TC23); large payload (TC21) and parallel updates (TC20).
Security: SQL injection attempt (TC14) covered by input validation.
gaps: Partial Update Behavior: No explicit test asserting whether partial updates are allowed or rejected (depends on API semantics).
Concurrency/Race Conditions: No dedicated test simulating concurrent updates to the same resource.
Rate Limiting: Not tested under PUT.
recommendations: Add a dedicated concurrency/race-condition test for PUT on the same invoice item to validate locking/atomicity.
Add explicit tests for partial updates to confirm whether the API supports or rejects partial field changes.
Introduce rate-limiting tests to verify handling of bursts or repeated requests within a short timeframe.
Add caching validation tests (ETag and Cache-Control headers) to ensure proper client-side caching behavior.
Enhance negative testing coverage with boundary data types and values for CustomField properties (e.g., nulls, empty strings).
